intro: Homeria flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered homeria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
